intro: Pavetta intermedia, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Pavetta intermedia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
